4. Since p = 2k, p is divisible by 2.
5. Since p > 2 and p is divisible by 2, p is not prime.
6. This contradicts premise 1 (p is prime).
7. Therefore, p is not even, so p is odd. QED.

We need to check if this syllogism is valid and if each member is logically connected to the previous one.
